product_title: Baume & Mercier Men's 8851 Classima Executives Chronograph White Dial Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Finally took the plunge.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2013
review_body: I've been researching a luxury watch for some time, and this is the one I finally settled on.  I could not be more pleased.  It has an elegant, classical appeal - which some may find old fashioned - but it sits very nicely on my wrist.  The black band, silver case, white face and uncluttered display are very pleasing to the eye.  I found the BM clasp a bit fiddly at first, but now I have adapted and enjoy the flat buckle fit.  Although I didn't realise it at the time of purchase, it has a 24 hour subdial, with a secondary time zone hand - an unexpected bonus.  Very happy indeed.

product_title: Baume & Mercier Men's 8851 Classima Executives Chronograph White Dial Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Elegant Watch
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2012
review_body: I purchased this watch from an authorized Baume & Mercier dealer.  I did so because they added one year to the warranty and do all of the repairs and maintenance (if needed) on site.  In addition, they did give me a nice reduction in price, which I have found is not unusual for upscale watches.  Okay, it isn't as good a price as I could get on line, but this is not a gray market watch and comes with a full U.S. warranty.  Often, the discounted watches are gray market and do not come with an American warranty.  I looked at other watches, including one by Tag Heuer and also Mont Blanc.  But when I saw them in person, I found that they looked like very expensive sports watches.  To be sure, they were very fine looking.  But for me I find that the Baume & Mercier looks more elegant.  This is a watch that I will not wear daily (I am very active in the high Rockies ... wearing a Baume & Mercier while backcountry skiing at 12,000 ft altitude is sort of over the top).  I have recently purchased a watch winder so that the watch will not loose time while it sits in its case.  This has been a great purchase, looks wonderful, and is a great anniversary gift for me!

review_title: Well made watch, but I'm upset with the seller (Watch your wrist)
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2015
review_body:
the watch is amazing and it is very nice and well manufactured by Raymond weil, the combination between the silver and rose gold are so nice and really you will enjoy wearing it because it will reflect a very generous look and personality. I just have an issue with the seller (watch your wrist), thats I am living outside USA and in Amazon if you live outside USA and you send the airway bill and order number they will return the tax, I have sent four emails to the seller but they are skipping me. the seller is good except with this issue.
thats why I set three stars.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Masterful
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2015
review_body: I love this watch, it simple yet beautiful.  You can't appreciate it fully until you put it on your wrist. I also love the fact it's a dive watch that doesn't look like it's trying to copy a Rolex Submariner.

product_title: Omega Men's 23330412101001 Seamaster300 Analog Display Swiss Automatic Silver Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Maybe the best modern Diver
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2016
review_body:
This is a really spectacular watch.  I wore a Submariner no date for years, and it was a great watch, but I didn't like the newly updated version with the ceramic dial (a nice upgrade) and the bulging body (blingy and unbecoming for a Rolex). This watch combines the best attributes of both Submariners (a classic design with a nearly indestructible ceramic bezel), with Omega's terrific co-axial caliber 8400 movement, which keeps time as well or better than any watch I've owned. The photos do not capture how well the polished links and bezel elements pick up the light and contrast with the matte black bezel with vintage style lume (though do be prepared to wipe it regularly, the mirror like finish does pick up finger prints quickly).  And if you don't want to deal with fingerprints, it also looks great and understated on a NATO, as seen in James Bond Spectre.  It's just an overall stunning watch in person that immediately displaced the rest of my collection as my daily wearer, and yes, it will go SCUBA diving with me soon enough.

I can say I would take this without hesitation over the new SubC and it has (at least for now) relegated my older Sub to the closet. The Jaeger Tribute to Deepsea and Blancpain Fifty Fathoms are very similar looking; they obviously have a rarity factor that the Omega doesn't, but I'm not sure they're better watches, espeiclaly when you look at things like the 8400s unique co-axial technology and 15,000 gauss anti-magnetic protection. Throw in a not insignificant price difference and it was an easy call for me.

Highly recommended.

Raymond Weil Men's 5576-ST-00307 Tradition Stainless Steel Case Black Leather Strap with Crocodile Pattern Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Traditional Excellence
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2012
review_body: The Raymond Weil Tradition Watch offers the flexibility for use in both casual dress or business suit applications. The watch is of a timeless design and is of very high quality and build. The Swiss ETA movement is the finest such Quartz movement available today and the case is equal in quality to most all of the finest Swiss manufacturers. The face of the watch is a perfect size and the Genuine Crocodile Leather Strap is elegant and a keeper. Considering the watch is being sold today at 55% off list price; this represents one of the best values out there. A similiar Baume Mercier or Oris Watch would run about $1,300 to $3,500. The overall look and quality is better than similiar Tissot Classics especially the movement itself. This Raymond Weil has an inspired look of a Patek Phillippe yet retains the elegant casual look of a Baume Mercier Watch. Amazing looks, great value and a great addition to any collection!!!

product_title: Raymond Weil Men's 4830-PC5-05658 Maestro Rose Gold-Tone Sta
reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Nice looks, but...
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2016
review_body: It is a nice looking watch alright, if you like gold tone dress watches with silver tone dial, and I wear it occasionally. The size is just right, not tiny, but far from ostentatious. But the quality does seem somewhat suspect. After only a few months, some cogs are skipped when winding manually, not a good sign even for this lower end brand. Other than that it still works fine though, and I have it on a winder, so we'll see.

product_title: Raymond Weil Men's 4830-PC5-05658 Maestro Rose Gold-Tone Sta
reviews:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Beware
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2016
review_body: Initially loved this watch, it appeals to the aesthetic senses and served its function well. However I started running into problems about two months in when it stopped ticking while still on my wrist, suggesting that the self winding movement was going through some problems. However this eventually went away and I thought it some sort of clockwork hiccup. About 4 days before the return deadline it completely stopped functioning; no amount of winding, or moral encouragements could get it to tick again. I didn't spend close to a grand for a lackadaisical watch, although I suppose that could add some character. Whether this is Amazon's handling/QA fault or Raymond Weil's is the question. Either way, my refund was not processed because while I dropped it off at UPS 2 days prior to the cut off, it didn't arrive until a couple of days later so buyers beware.

product_title: Omega Men's 2909.50.38 Seamaster Planet Ocean Automatic Chronometer Orange Leather Watch
Omega Men's 2909.50.38 Seamaster Planet Ocean Automatic Chronometer Orange Leather Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Watchmakers Advice
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2007
review_body:
I am rather opinionated when it comes to luxury watches.  This comes from spending 2 years in watchmaking school, studying directly under the guidance of a certified master swiss watchmaker who came here from Europe.  Watches, especially mid to high grade swiss watches, are a passion of mine.  I am not loyal to a brand or a style or anything else.  I judge them for what they are, in terms of quality, function, construction, and style.  A watchmakers point of view.

This said I will tell you that this particular watch is what I consider to be a "best kept secret" sort of watch.  This is an AUTOMATIC watch (read: Mechanical - NOT Quartz), and of CHRONOMETER grade function.  Chronometer as used here is a measure of accurate timekeeping, not quality - a point often misunderstood - and is used mostly from a marketing point of view by companies such as Rolex.  HOWEVER.  This movement in THIS watch is actually EXCELLENT in terms of quality, time keeping ability, and construction - easily comparable to other Swiss made movements from other famous manufacturers costing several times as much.  This watch, properly serviced, will provide a lifetime of use - and probably more.  Absolutely the sort of watch you pass down to the next generation.

All in all - and EXCELLENT choice - especially for those seeking their first QUALITY Swiss watch purchase.

Definitely recommended!

The brown leather strap coupled with the subtle rose gold make it a versatile watch that pairs well with any outfit, allowing it to work perfectly as an everyday wrist piece. The quality is top notch--I've yet to discover any defects despite prolonged use. For the price point, Amorstil goes above and beyond with their product. Highly recommended! 10/10

Q&Q Men's PowerLite Classic Digital Watch #M051J002Y
Q&Q Men's PowerLite Classic Digital Watch #M051J002Y
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Highly Functional Watch
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2011
review_body: I love this watch. It has so many funtions, most in which I haven't been able to master using yet but I am working on it. To me this watch resembles a G-Shock, sort of, but far less expensive. It has an alarm fucntion as well as a timer, it tells you what day of the week it is. It can be set to military time and it chimes every hour on the hour. Some of the functions are hard to maneuvre around but if you play with it for a little while you will get the hang of it. The instructions that come with try their best to lead you through all the functions but some of it is trial and error, I think.

product_title: Rado Men's R12637203 Orginal Collection AutomaticWatch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    My second rado watch
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2009
review_body:
This is a second rado watch that I bought in the last couple years.  This one is a little bit different in style and more heavy than I expected.  My wrist starts to feel a little bit uncomfortable at first because of extra weight of this watch.  It is a unique dress watch that you don't see it everyday.  Would recommend this watch along with Oris.  If Rado ever redesign the bezel with more like a real normal watch instead of big, and heavy bezel like this one, I would probably add more rado to my collection.
Even though I like this watch, but for me, Oris is still far better in quality and price.

review_body:
First, don't listen to reviews that have nothing to do with the watch which serve no purpose and don't belong in a review section, but a seller section. Reviews should be about the watch, seller reviews should be about the seller. Buying from a unauthorized dealer in Israel and have omega pay for it has nothing to do with the watch itself. Nor does a delivery not happening have anything to do with the watch.

Now for a real review.

The attention to detail in this watch is on par with anything from a Automatic version of this watch. Only difference is the movement. Other than that they are the same. Being a person who owns a couple Rolex autos, omega autos, the fit and finish of this Aqua Terra and rivals
Any of them. What you are getting here is a watch with the build quality Omega is known for.

The new Quartz versions of this watch are not made as well as this one here. They have painted on indices, not applied, painted logo not applied. Here is a fast fact. They are not making anymore of this version of the Aqua Terra with the same build quality as the autos. The new ones compared to the Autos are made to look cheaper. These are not.

Omega is one of the top brand of watches in the world, period. Easily on par with Rolex, and in some cases surpasses them. Google a Rolex Sub vs a Sea-master and look at the comparisons. This watch is going to go up in value, since they don't make them anymore.

The watch face is 39.2 mm, compared to the newer models of 38.5mm. The movement in this is the Omega is the 1538 a rhodium plated 6 jewel movement. It has a independent hour hand setting for traveling which is convenient. I own a quartz Bond Sea-master and a 2016 Planet ocean auto. My seamaster with a 1538 quartz movement is accurate to 00.8 seconds a month! This is straight from Omega after a overhaul. My planet ocean isn't close to that and it has a Co-Axial 8500 movement which is considered by many as one of the most accurate on the planet, even surpasses the 3135 from a Rolex sub! Not that I am expecting a Auto to be as accurate as a quartz, since buying a Auto with the accuracy of a quartz isn't why a you buy a Auto. You buy a Auto for the craftsmanship and art of the movement. A quartz is bought for accuracy and convenience.

The band of the watch is superb, its sliding mechanism makes putting on and taking off the watch a breeze, the case is finely polished and the dial has the attention to detail which is expected of a Omega watch. The band is very comfortable and does not pinch the arm or gets uncomfortable after extended wear. My only gripe is that the clasp sliding mechanism could be a little shorter and it tends to make the weight of the watch a little uneven depending on where you have links removed. But hardly noticeable. Not a deal breaker by any means.

Omega's customer service is second to none. When you go to a Omega Boutique they have a sitting area with Cappuccino, Espresso, and your snack of choice, cookie, shortbread etc. You get pampered and are shown respect. Any thing I asked them to do they did happily! Never in the 15 years of owning a Omega have I had a bad experience with them. Now am i saying they don't mess up. No. They do. Everyone does, but they make it right in the long run. It's how they tackle and fix problems, not the problems themselves. That is a true mark excellence in my opinion. I get treated better by Omega than by Rolex.

Now is this a replacement for a Auto, no. It's not meant to be. But if you want a well made watch this is more accurate than any auto, has the build quality of Omega is known for and a customer experience to back it up. This Aqua Terra is a good choice.

product_title: Omega Men's 2517.30.00 Seamaster Aqua Terra Quartz Watch
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great Watch for a Quartz
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2009
review_body: Overall, the Omega Sea Master Aqua Terra is a beautiful watch that reflects a simple but elegant design and sturdy construction.  While this watch may not be as desirable as the automatic movement version, it is nevertheless a beautiful watch that works well and is a joy to own.  Plus think of it this way -- you don't have to worry about winding the watch every couple of days.  The trade-off is up to you.

product_title: Omega Men's 2517.30.00 Seamaster Aqua Terra Quartz Watch
reviews:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Bad quality, no service
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2011
review_body:
Bought Seamaster Aqua Terra Quartz in official dealer shop in Israel and actually was given already defected watch (sell person knew it well)- date setting function did not work.  Watch was exchanged and after 3 weeks of usage same issue re-occured already on new  watch.
 I took this upto Omega and Local  official dealer and explained, that I expected something more durable and honest starting from buying and  throughout  usage of "luxury" product
Solution from Omega? Take same watch 3rd time! For me twice was enough and I asked for some better solution and compensation for  my disappointment and dealer agreed to give me watch of ... TISSOT as a compensation. I was shocked and amused.
Attempt to explain difference between Omega and Tissot buyers profile were fruitless. Official dealer did nto agree to upgrade my watch to another Omega one for unhonesty of their shop during purchase and product  bad quality.
At the end, after  3 months,  my purchase was refunded, watch returned  and I was granted to pick up complimentary SWATCH  watch for all the inconvenience  :-)
Offical Omega? No response at all.
So for me and my family members Omega is the sign of bad quality, ugly customer support and not understanding their customer profile. My advice to collegues and friends - never buy Omega, especially in Israeli "Impress" shops and "Roltime Ltd" dealer.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great time piece!!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2016
review_body: I've been looking at Breitling for years but have been hesitant due to the weight that these watches can pack. I prefer larger watches because I have large hands, but I'm not crazy about having a heavy item strapped to my wrist. --->Finally, Breitling has designed a watch perfect to my needs. It's a 45mm watch that wears more like a 44mm. It is titanium, which is substantially lighter than stainless steel, and has a 22mm canvas strap that tapers down to 20mm. It has a rubber inlay which keeps the watch from sliding up and down the wrist, holding it in one position throughout the day. I love it. I'll come back in 6 months to provide an update on the build quality of the strap, and give an honest opinion on my first, post honeymoon, Breitling experience.

    Descent Value, Nice Looking, But Strap is a Bit Small.
review_title: Descent Value, Nice Looking, But Strap is a Bit Small.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2014
review_body:
I purchased this item because I wanted a sports like all-purpose watch to wear on game days to the Liberty Bowl Stadium and FedEx Forum for University of Memphis games.  I had a dressy type of UM logo watch but it was not appropriate for every occasion.

My biggest fear prior to ordering this watch was that the face and strap will be too small for a man.  I ordered another brand in the past and ended up giving it to my girlfriend because it was made more for either a woman's or child's wrist.

This one arrive in great shape and well packaged in a plastic case.  The face of the watch is still not as large as I prefer, but it is acceptable (I enjoy wearing large face sports watches).  The strap is a bit short for a male's wrist, but I ended up pulling the Velcro strap through the first opening of the fastener and it works just fine.  So far so good on quality and durability, and I've worn it to a couple of football games.

The biggest take-away is to give this watch second thoughts if you have a large wrist (unless you do not mind purchasing a new strap for it).  Otherwise it is a good buy at $27.  I will provide an update towards the end of the football season.

Go Tigers!!

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    One watch to rule them all!!
review_title: One watch to rule them all!!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2022
review_body: This one is hard to photograph as the domed sapphire and the bezel plays tricks with the light by design along with all the reflective polished edges and surfaces too many to count. I bought mine at a GS boutique while they were in stock. Need to check out the video reviews on this watch!! The watch itself is absolute perfection. I'm wearing mine now as I write this. It's a perfect size watch for medium wrist sizes. It's comfortable to wear and the crown does not get in the way of wrist motion. The crown has the GS logo. The GMT bezel is indeed bi-colored which does not appear in the stock photo but when you view it from PoV of your eyes it will refract the light such that you can tell the daylight half. It has an opencase back. It's a limited edition.

reviews:

    Minute hand fell of after Day 2 - Buyer Beware
review_title: Minute hand fell of after Day 2 - Buyer Beware
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2015
review_body: I gave this watch to my boyfriend when we went for our overseas trip. After 2 days the minute hand fell off after he took the watch off. The watch was not dropped or abused in any way. The quality of this watch is appalling. The manufacturers and Sturhrling should be ashamed of themselves. The packaging and the watch itself may be nice but if it breaks 2 days after you buy it, then buyers better hope that they buy it from a source that they can easily return the item to.

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 785.02 Winchester Mechanical Bridge Black Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    patent leather and it's nicely padded on the inside
review_title: patent leather and it's nicely padded on the inside
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2014
review_body: I purchased this for my son on an Amazon Lightning Deal for just under $100. Contrary to the other review I saw, I found this watch to be well worth the money. The leather band is a shiny, patent leather and it's nicely padded on the inside. Everything was attached properly and is working fine. The face is sturdy and seems to be of good quality. There are hundreds of Stuhrling designs out there and reviews are overwhelming positive, especially on the skeleton watches. This is my son's second Stuhrling and his first (two years old now) is still in great condition. Note that he is a 17 year old and generally hard on his things. I'll update my review if after he receives the gift, we find any problems.

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 785.02 Winchester Mechanical Bridge Black Watch
reviews:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    **Cheap Junk! Do Not Buy!**
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2014
review_body:
This watch was nowhere near the quality of the photos nor the suggested retail price. No way this is a $700+ watch. It is overpackaged to look fancy, but it's just a lot of cheap packaging surrounding a junk watch. The description boasts of fine Swiss design, Swiss quality, and produced with strict oversight by Swiss engineers, but the one tiny sticker I found which was the ONLY place anywhere that said where it was actually made..."Made in China". The leather band was horribly fake plastic looking, the metal feels cheap, and....this is the capper....the minute hand wasn't even attached! It was rattling around loose inside the face of the watch.

This product is cheap JUNK!!

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 785.02 Winchester Mechanical Bridge Black Watch
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Unlike most other watches I have worm in my life this does not snag on my wrist hair like most metal watches do
review_title: Unlike most other watches I have worm in my life this does not snag on my wrist hair like most metal watches do
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2015
review_body: 12/31/2014: I have owned the watch for just over 3 weeks now.  Does not require a battery to run just need to ensure you wind it twice a day or so, I find i do it quite often now out of habit. A few complaints I have so far is the minute hand seems to fall behind every few days where I find myself resetting the time after it starts to fall behind a few minutes, I'm not sure if it's not counting seconds properly or what, I don't claim to be a watch expert.  While the band had a leather smell to it and still seems to be holding up so far, however the 2 straps that you tuck the excess band into do not seem to be made out of leather as I can already see a bit of wear on them and they definitely are not as shiny as the rest of the leather band. I don't wear it in the shower even though it's supposed to be water resistant just out of caution and the inner side of the band is more porous and has a slight odor with sweat after the 3 weeks of wear.  Unlike most other watches I have worm in my life this does not snag on my wrist hair like most metal watches do. The face and metal still show no visible scratches on the glass which makes me hope it's good quality.  Most watches I've ever owned usually have scratched faces after only owning for a week or so. I'll update in a few weeks.

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 160F2.332U52 Special Reserve Apocalypse Trifecta Chronograph Date Silver Dial Blue Bezel Watch
Stuhrling Original Men's 160F2.332U52 Special Reserve Apocalypse Trifecta Chronograph Date Silver Dial Blue Bezel Watch
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Unique Timepiece
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2012
review_body:
I did not purchase this item from Amazon, but I just wanted to tell everyone about the beauty and quality of this watch. This timepiece comes in 3 colors. Blue, red and green. I was fortunate enough to see all 3 models in a Houston store. I also own the red. The green model is super kewl, but it is GREEN, GREEN, GREEN.

I recommend this watch to everyone who wants a watch that is unique and different. However, I can only rate this watch at 4 stars because of the strap. It looks beautiful, but is stiff as plywood. I wore for a month, but still had to fight taking it on/off. Not kewl for this price.

I ended up buying an alligator strap with deployment clasp off Ebay for $15 as a replacement. Now I wear both watches all the time.

One last comment. The Apocalypse series is the Epiphany Collection not Special Reserve. Check out the other Apocalypse models at sturhling.com. They are all awesome!

review_body: Precision made. Bought it for it's looks.and name. The deciding factor was the red duals. Elegnant, dressy, thin and being a collector one of my dad favorites. The ceramic band Like very much.

product_title: Rado Men's R27677152 True Black High Tech Ceramic Bracelet Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very Nice Watch
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2014
review_body: This is a pretty solid watch.  It's a less expensive Rado than most, so you can expect to get a little less (mostly in the 'wow' factor, however).  I sized it myself.  Not using the recommended tools is a bit of a risk, but I was able to take a slat off of each side with not much frustration and thankfully no scratches.  The Ceramic Slats are way cool.  They aren't as smooth and glossy as the pictures show (thank God).  More like a black stainless steel.  They look kick-ass.  The bezel is fairly flat, but not nearly as flat as my old Movado Museum.  On some of the higher-ended Rados, they have the ultra flat, low profile bezel/crystal (that's the 'wow' factor I was talking about above that is missing somewhat with this watch).  The black on black with red highlights are what appealed most to me about this watch.  I grew up in the 80s when Swatches were the thing.  This to me, has that same kind of look but with more modern high tech components (Ceramic, Quartz and Sapphire Crystal).  I am interested to see how well it keeps time over a period of a few months.  That will be a big factor.  But for now, I'm happy after nearly a week.

product_title: Tudor Heritage Black Bay Men's Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Killer value
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_body:
As an avid collector of dive watches, I can say that entire Tudor line is superb, especially with their new in house movement that can maintain a crazy 70 hr power reserve. This watch is a perfect size, its relation to Rolex is obvious. I am not a gold fan on wristwatches but the very subtle outlines of the dots and hands add some great sizzle to this piece. I own three black bays - one with the older ETA movement, and two with the new movement. If there is one thing I am not crazy about its the riveted bracelet but apparently I am in the minority on this. The older versions have the bracelet with no rivets which I think is cleaner. Howeve of the three I won this one gets the most wear.

This is the best value for the price for any luxury timepiece out there. By a mile.

reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Had to sell some assets, but moderately satisfied.
review_title: Had to sell some assets, but moderately satisfied.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2016
review_body: I mean, it's alright. I was thinking my wife would like it but I had to sell her to buy it, which you might think makes it pointless. But I had reached that point where you're just committed; you've made the decision in your mind and you're like, 'alright, I'm doing this' and you can't back down because if you go back on what you've decided in your mind, what kind of man are you? I mean, if you can't even stick to your own ideals, what can you stick to? So I had reached that point and realized that I didn't have the money. Well now it became a problem solving venture. I had to figure this out. I could sell the house, but then how could I keep my investment safe? I could sell my truck, but I gotta get to work to pay for the insurance on it. I could have sold my kids, but you know, future of the nation and all. So I finally settled on selling my wife. They are renewable resources as far as being able to find another and continue to do god's work. Luckily, I was able, through thrifty money wrangling, to make a decent profit, even after purchasing the watch. Now, the watch itself is a fine piece. The hands on the face a clear and easy to see. It keeps time well, although you do have to set in manually. The back is pretty neat; being able to see the workings and all. The band could use some improvement. The material is rather warm and the color isn't my cup of tea. If only my wife could have seen it. Oh well. I'm thinking of purchasing a second one to keep in a lock box. Oh, if anyone is interested, I have for sale a sturdy, hardworking personal assistant. He is about 13 and is capable of traveling at 8 mph and has a range of 80 miles on a single fill up. He is capable of lifting almost 130 lbs, but that can pushed to 160 lbs with the use of included cattle prod. If interested, feel free to contact my sales agent.

reviews:

    Nice bracelet, awkward face...
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2017
review_body: The band on this watch is pretty nice actually, both in terms of the gold color and the dual tone and texture links in the bracelet. But the face has an underwhelming, drug-store watch looking design on the dial. And to make matters worse, the crystal on the face has an unusually elevated, dome-like shape to it, which looks awkward and also distorts your view of the face when looking from certain angles. Not a terrible watch, but the bracelet doesn't justify buying a watch with a face like this. I guess you could say this watch is a butterface. Heyo.

reviews:

    Star of a Constellation
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2008
review_body:
One of the most beautiful watches I have, Swiss made, automatic, chronometer and maybe, the most important, versatile (could be wear both at the board meeting or with sport clothing).

What do you could want more?

product_title: Omega Men's 1202.30.00 Constellation Two-Tone Automatic Chronometer Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Versatile
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2009
review_body: This watch is very versatile.  You can wear it anywhere any time.  It is heavy for it's size but light as far as mens watches go.  It is extremely durable.  I wear it diving, working in the yard, at the office, to dinner, where ever.  It is amazing the times I have accidently dragged this watch against a brick wall on a crowded street and it still does not have a scratch on the sapphire crystal.  It is a great value for a swiss timepiece.

review_body: I bought this watch five years ago. I never take it off except to shower. I've had lots of comments about my Omega. I work outside with it on as well as all other tasks. It is amazing the crystal has not been scratched. The only reason I rated this as a four star is the fact I have to reset the time weekly. The watch falls behind three minutes every week. It is past time for its cleaning which might be the problem. I hope so, I used to have to correct the time every month.

product_title: Breitling Men's BTA1733110-F563SS Avenger II Seawolf Analog Display Swiss Automatic Silver Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The watch is beautiful, when you can see it
review_title: The watch is beautiful, when you can see it
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2016
review_body: I Recently purchased this watch from a local jeweler, so it was a bit more expensive than here, but I have peace of mind as well. The watch is beautiful, when you can see it. The numbers disappear when not in bright light. It is not comfortable to wear and is the heaviest watch I own. For reference my Tag Heuer  F-1 auto chrono is the most comfortable bracelet watch I own. The Breitling bezel seems thick and the dial seems small, given it's a 45mm width. The reason I have this is because I went for the Super Avenger chrono, but at 48mm it was WAAAAAY too big for my smaller wrist. There is no denying the quality you will get with an authentic Breitling. I do love this watch and have worn it a few times already. I have quite a few watches so it's more of a round-robin situation for me. The volcano black dial is very black, but not shiny. There is just enough red to add interest, but avoid fashion fatigue. The stencil like numerals give it a tougher look. The watch sits high above the wrist and is very thick.

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 186B.33111 Aristocrat Elite Quartz Chronograph Black Dial Watch
reviews:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Crystal is low quality....
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2009
review_body: I bought this watch a few months ago and from the time I received it I've loved it.  It's a gorgeous watch and the size is perfect (for my larger wrist).  Now, on to the negative.  I researched this watch for hours on the internet before buying and seen very few negatives about the watch.  One of my main concerns was the quality of the crystal.  This watch (supposedly) has a Krysterna crystal which is one of the strongest crystals a watch can have.  They're supposed to be basically indestructible.  I've worn this watch almost everyday since owning and wear it to work and in casual settings.  This watch did NOT get abused in any way.  I noticed one day though that there was a scratch on the crystal.  I was furious, as I'm sure most would be.  So, I took it off and the next day I looked at the watch again and it had cracked the ENTIRE way through from side to side.  My watch now needs a replacement crystal, which I'm sure isn't cheap.  The crystal is NOT covered through the warranty.  Stuhrling claims to sell "quality" pieces but I beg to differ.  So, stay away from this watch, or at least buying through amazon (I now question if the watch was authentic).

reviews:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Vastly overpriced, even at the Amazon price.
review_title: Vastly overpriced, even at the Amazon price.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2018
review_body:
These watches are your average Wal-Mart/Target low-end watch, dressed up by marketing to be something more than they are. They have:

- Ruthlessly basic quartz movement
- Very little heft
- Very little in the way of build quality
- Very little in the way of features

When you actually hold them in your hand and examine them, they compare equally to unbranded/generic Wal-Mart/Target watches in the $20-$30 retail range. I certainly wouldn't pay more than that for this watch.

And frankly, you'll get a far better watch spending $30-$40 on a Timex, which while basic and meant to be, is built to a generally higher quality level. Do not pay MSRP on these for any reason ($300 range is laughable) and do not even pay the Amazon price without handling one first, as you're likely to imagine that you're getting more for it than you actually are.

    But the disk-like thing the band holds is completely useless as a timepiece
review_title: But the disk-like thing the band holds is completely useless as a timepiece
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2015
review_body: This watch is a lovely object--sleek, chiseled, and dark.  It has a handsome mesh wristband and a well-designed, secure clasp.  But the disk-like thing the band holds is completely useless as a timepiece.  The clock face can only be read in better-than-medium light.  There is absolutely no contrast between the black clock face and the black hands.  If you need to know what time it is, the sun had better be high in the sky.  Otherwise, this model is just a nice bracelet. I'll return it immediately.

A very good looking watch. But, one of the small metal elements of the wristband got busted when I was wearing a sweater. It's not a big deal tho, got fixed easily.

Update Aug-16: I've been wearing this watch exactly for a year and this is a good product. I don't understand what people are expecting from this dark-themed watch. It is all black, from the case to the minute and second hands. The picture tells, everybody. Look at the picture. If you don't want a watch that you can't see under decent light source, so do not buy it. It is not for you. But because of this design, this watch looks very cool and minimalist. Very. I still get compliments to the watch. It is a two-in-one, decent watch and wrist band. I would give this 4 stars because the case is brushed metal and I wear it upside down of my arm, so the corners and metal around the face got a little worn-off as I rub my arm to table and different surfaces. I wish it was painted well enough to hold its color a little longer. Other than that, I am very satisfied with this purchase and thinking about getting the winston royale silver one.

product_title: Komono Unisex Winston Royale Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This watch is beautiful. I've been looking for a green face watch
review_title: This watch is beautiful. I've been looking for a green face watch
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2016
review_body: This watch is beautiful. I've been looking for a green face watch, and although I saw this first, I actually bought an MK watch. But due to an incident the watch did not come and I ended up buying this one. At first, I was surprised by how big it was as I have really skinny wrists (it says it is unisex), but everyone loved it on me and I grew to love it! The green is beautiful and so is the gold (although at times it looks like a fake gold to me, but I don't care so much). The only gripe I have is the latch to undo the watch. After constantly readjusting the watch to fit my wrist, putting the watch on, then removing the watch, my fingers stated to hurt since it's kinda tough to undo. That's probably a good thing though, as you know it won't unlatched itself easily. But man...my fingers hurt. I love the size now, but I might have loved it even more if the face was a bit smaller.

product_title: KOSPET Tank S1+Tank M2
product_description: Military Standard Verification - Special composite materials and metal shell makes our smart watches for men pass twelve of standard tests including damp heat, shock test, low temperature test high temperature test, vibration test, rain test, salt spray test, low pressure test, fungus test, contamination by fluids test, sand and dust test, solar radiation test etc. Fitness watch can undoubtedly become your reliable companion when you like outdoor activities.     60+ days standby - M2 uses 100% pure cobalt battery (military grade), with battery capacity up to 380mAh which is 2-3 times the capacity of ordinary smart watches; At the same time, the super dual film Bluetooth chip processor and super power saving AI algorithm are used to minimize the power consumption, which ensures an unending long standby time of 45-60 days and daily use of 10-15 days.     Multiple sports modes - Supports as many as 70 sports modes, including hiking, skiing, swimming and other indoor and outdoor workouts. Empowered by our all - new sporting algorithm, the smartwatch makes data acquisition far more precise. The sports watch has as smart recognition and reminder mechanism of 6 sports - stationary state, walking, running, cycling, elliptical and rower. The system can automatically sense current sport status without entering sports modes manually.     Smart tracking and monitoring - Harnesses the leading PPG BioTracker optical sensor that complements our independently innovated sporting algorithm, which helps you maintain your health by monitoring heart rate, sleep and blood oxygen on-demand. Tracks and assesses your sleep in various dimensions, such as exercise status and heart rate. It also monitors accurate analysis of your sleep quality and generates comprehensive data accordingly, even during short duration naps.     Ultra high performance waterproof technology - Incredible static waterproof, up to 50m, thanks to its elaborate water-resistant design featuring waterproof speakers and MIC, M2 boasts 5ATM static waterproof, allowing it to withstand the equivalent of 50 meters water pressure. Concurrently M2 has got through the demanding IP69K rating test, so that you can wear it during all day-to-day water sports and activities such as swimming, diving, surfing and more.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Beautiful watch, excellent service
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2009
review_body:
I bought this watch from Amazon few days back through my firend account. its far more beautiful that what it looks on the picture. worth each penny spent.

service was excellent. i recieved all items on time and in excellent shape. but i have 2 comments for Amazon

i was charged with a duty of 128 dollars which is too much for this watch. it was my first item where i wwas charged with duty although i have bought some items before as well. may be recession having an effect on amazon as well

secondly, the watch does not come with manufacturers warranty. instead, you have a 2 years warranty from amazon. i dont mind having an amazon warranty but still i would prefer the manufacturer warranty as it means that i can get service anywhere in the world and dont need to send my watch back to amazon everytime

overall experience was worth it and i will buy from amazon again

product_title: TAG Heuer Men's CAF7111.BA0803 Aquaracer Calibre S Regatta Collection Chronograph Stainless Steel Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Everything I hoped it would be
review_title: Everything I hoped it would be
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2010
review_body:
My 9 year old Tag Heuer Teal Professional Quartz watch is still a beautiful timepiece and I will continue to wear it in rotation, but I wanted to move up a notch. I shopped for weeks looking for something in my price range with all the correct features.

This watch caught my eye because of the color and I appreciated the concept of the hybrid electromechanical drive. As an engineer, time accuracy is important. I didn't want a strictly automatic engine because of the annoying minor time drift most suffer from. Adjusting the watch becomes more of a hobby than it needs to be and I am sure I would obsess about it.

This watch is substantial. It has the nice, heavy feel I enjoy having on my wrist. The band is wonderful. I looked at a few Breitling watches, but the bands turned me off because of the way they tear arm hair out. The Tag Heuer band does not. It's bright and shiny and reflects light in a most enjoyable way.

I will likely use the chronograph features of this watch only a few times a year. Unlike a lot of chronographs, the timer functions on this watch are unobtrusive. (It uses the clock hands for timing at the press of a button!)

It's a little tricky to set this watch up. It has "modes" of operation unlocked based on the position of the sweep hand and the crown stop. The calendar is perpetual. That's a welcome feature. You set it and forget it. No more being bothered by having to manually adjust the date at the end of months of less than 31 days. It's Leap Year aware as well.

If you are looking for a quality luxury watch at an affordable price point, you can't go wrong with a Tag Heuer like this one.

    Wrong watch delivered. Very poor after sales service! buy from Jomashop
review_title: Wrong watch delivered. Very poor after sales service! buy from Jomashop
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2009
review_body:
The watch in itself is very nice. Amazon screwed up my order and delivered a citizen instead. It has been over 6 weeks and ~30 phone calls and i still have not recd my money back from Amazon. Had to actually order the watch from Amazon. Amazon is great if they can get your order right. God forbid if they mess it up, they have no system or process in place to take care of you.

Go to a specialized watch eretailer. That would be my advice.

product_title: TAG Heuer Men's CAF7111.BA0803 Aquaracer Calibre S Regatta Collection Chronograph Stainless Steel Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Interesting Timepiece
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2009
review_body:
A short review of this watch:

Weight:  It was not as heavy as I expected (even though it is quartz and I knew it would be lighter than an automatic), but it has a substantial quality to it. If you are new to the luxury watch market and are worried about getting used to the weight, this might be a good selection. For those that love a big heavy watch, this is probably too light for your taste, but like I said, still substantial.  I like a heavy watch, and while this is far from the heaviest that I own, I'm still pleased with it from this aspect.

Size: With dimensions of 43mm and 13 mm, I again was surprised by the relative size. As with the weight, the size is substantial, but it's nowhere near the size of another 43mm and 13mm watch that I have. (yes, it measures the correct dimensions, but this watch is crafted in a way where it tapers from the middle to the top and bottom in a very stylish manner making it appear smaller than the dimensions would otherwise lead you to believe.) Again still substantial, and a good comprise between the understated nature of a Patek and the monsterous quality of a Breitling (and yes, much cheaper than either of those as well, but just an example for purposes of comparison).

Overall on size, I think it's a good balance. I would not imagine any adult male complaining about the watch's size (too big or too small) after a week or so of wearing it.

Bracelet/Band:  Looks like the picture. This particular band has 2 additional flat surfaces on each shiny link (the shiny center link is squared at the top and the bottom) compared to other watches that i own/have seen. It catches the light more than your standard band of this style which I like.  At a glance it looks a little different than the more common type of this watch band where the center shiny links have rounded edges. Admittedly, this is a very subtle difference.

Perpetual calendar: Had to read the manual to figure out how to change the time, date, year, but once you figure it out, it's very logical. There is even a "cheat sheet" engraved on the back of the watch to remind you when the season's change and you don't feel like digging up the manual. The perpetual calendar is a nice feature so you only have to set the date once (and then whenever the battery runs out.) The bottom half moon dials tell you the date in regular time mode.

Chronograph: This watch uses the main hands as its chronograph which makes it very easy to read.  A little different than most other chronographs so a nice change if you collect watches, or if you hate all of the dials on the face of the watch but still want a chronograph.

Ragatta function: This is basically a countdown mode. It uses the hour and minute hand moving together counting down on the hours markers from 10 to 0. The thought here is that you get 10 minutes to set your boats up in a boat race and this watch counts those 10 minutes down for you. There is also apparently an additional 5 minutes that you get in the race that the watch can also countdown.  In all likelihood a completely worthless feature from a functionality perspective for nearly everyone who buys this watch, but its something your boss's watch probably won't do, for what that's worth.

Overall:  The only complaint that I have is the type of links this watch uses. They are nearly impossible to remove yourself without risking bending a pin. Take it to a watch store to get that taken care of. The watch itself is very nice, and for amazon's price, I think you're getting an extremely good deal. Own a lot of watches, and spent a great deal of time researching this purchase, and I'm very pleased.

product_title: TAG Heuer Men's CAF7111.BA0803 Aquaracer Calibre S Regatta Collection Chronograph Stainless Steel Watch
reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Different - has issues
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2023
review_body:
This watch is different. There is no manual adjustments. Everything is electronic and runs off the battery. Even the crown doesn't move the hour and minute hands. It has dual motors in it that perform all the movements. Everything is set by pressing the buttons and the battery in this is larger, and harder to find than most as a result. I had to go to batteries+ to get it.

This watch is on the lighter side but still heavy enough to indicate that it is solid. The dial does not move. It is for this weird regatta countdown that only is useful for people who sail and participate in sailboat racing.

I do like the feel of this watch. The latch is nice and tight. The bracelet is very sharp looking and shines quite well after every polish. This watch will not scream luxury - it is more casual.

What I don't like about this watch is that it gets out of sync and gets misaligned often. This is a problem for many people. I bought this over ten years ago and sent it in twice to get realigned. Turns out there is a factory reset function that allows you to realign all the hands to the zero position. Again, all done electronically. As simple as that might be, it does take about ten to fifteen minutes to do it and set the time again.

I would not buy this watch again, and I don't think they even sell it anymore. It is a unique concept but a watch that costs this much should not need to be re calibrated a few times a year. It appears that Tag Heuer tried too hard to make all of this electronic and the complication of how to set it, multiple countdown functions, perpetual calendar, etc. and it didn't work out perfectly.

    ... my second purchase from Jace Watches and I absolutely love it. The packaging is very well equipped I ...
review_title: ... my second purchase from Jace Watches and I absolutely love it. The packaging is very well equipped I ...
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2018
review_body: This is my second purchase from Jace Watches and I absolutely love it. The packaging is very well equipped I knew my watch was not damaged on the way and what was super cool is they sent me a FREE band to interchange!  My favorite thing about these watches is the low cost but high end quality. The one thing that stood out to me was the sapphire face on all their watches (scratch proof!!) while my other brand watches that are more expensive do not have this feature. I also found out that all the bands with Jace watches are interchangeable giving me more options of a different look with my watches. They are also waterproof! I don't have to worry when washing my hands, taking a shower or even swimming for that matter lol. And to put the cherry on top it meant a lot to me to know that they are donating proceeds to charities around the world. I also had questions about all the details to the watches and their customer service was great with fast response, I even got to speak with the guy who created the line of watches himself!! You will not be disappointed.

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 394.33112 Classic Winchester Pro Mechanical Hand Wind Skeleton Silver Dial Watch
reviews:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    BROKE 3 TIMES (after repairs) - POOR QUALITY
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2014
review_body:
This watch is incredibly poorly made. It completely lacks quality. It is very nice to look at but it broke (second hand fell of and got stuck) LITERALLY 1 month after I bought it. I am a doctor and only wear it to the office twice a week. Which means it broke after less than 10 days of use.

I requested a refund from the company, they said no. I sent it in for a repair after I HAD TO PAY for shipping. It came back working, but then the second hand fell off again after 2 months, again with minimal use. I sent it again (Yes, after I had to pay AGAIN for shipping). It worked for about 2 more months until the second hand fell of again.

I am not making any of this up. Please see the attached picture of what to expect: the second hand fell off and got stuck rendering the watch useless.

DO NOT BUY this watch.

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 394.33112 Classic Winchester Pro Mechanical Hand Wind Skeleton Silver Dial Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Beautiful, intricate, and a great deal
review_title: Beautiful, intricate, and a great deal
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2013
review_body:
I got this as a gift for my boyfriend and he really loves it. He can wear it with his casual shirts/button downs and it doesn't look too flashy, but when he does get dressed it fits very well. He always gets compliments and people ask about his watch when they notice the mechanical face and he loves taking it off and showing them the back. He is an engineer and loves how this watch works.

It keeps pretty accurate time when it is moving. If you take it off and don't wear it for awhile you will have to reset the time. But once it's moving its accurate within a minute. He did have to take it to a jeweler to remove the extra link. They have instructions on how to pop it out but it is much more difficult than it looks. It's easier to have someone who knows what they're doing take it out.

A great buy for the price. This was a starter watch for him and would be a great present for any teenager or young man.

product_title: Raymond Weil Men's 9578-STC-00300 "Tradition" Analog Black Dress Watch
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Beautiful watch but there are a couple of issues.
review_title: Beautiful watch but there are a couple of issues.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2016
review_body:
This is my third Raymond Weil watch and I'm a fan of the brand so my review might be a little biased.

I really love this watch and I get lots of compliments when I wear it. I'd go as far as to say this is my favorite watch in my collection. As another reviewer said, pictures do not do it justice. It's very refined looking and elegant in an understated way. It's is a large watch but not it's uncomfortably large or heavy. However, it is large enough to make buttoning the sleeves of some brands of dress shirts almost impossible (no problems with French cuffs though). Not really an issue for me,  I just pick a shirt that works with the watch.

The only thing I really didn't like about this watch was the band. I don't have a really large wrist but the stock band on this watch looked tiny and cheap. Not what I'd expect on a watch that supposedly retailed for $1,250.00. Perhaps I got a watch set up for a market other than the US, I'm not sure. However, I swapped it out for a Hadley Roma contrast stitch band and it completely transformed the watch. Made it super stunning! Issue solved but that's a one star deduct since I had to buy a band for a brand new watch.

The only real problem I've had in a year of ownership is with the durability of the inner works. The watch slipped off my bed and fell onto a rug that was on a hardwood floor. That two foot fall knocked the hands out of alignment and jarred something inside that made the watch completely stop. I took it to my jeweler and he got it working again but now it's randomly stopping so it's back at the jeweler again. Hopefully he can find the problem and get it resolved this time. Since I caused the  issue I'm not deducting any stars but buyers need to be aware that these watches are quite fragile.

Overall, I love the watch and if this one can't be repaired I'll consider buying another. I'll just be a lot more careful with the replacement.

product_title: rougois Mechanique Silver Skeleton Watch Leather Black Rivet Band
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Gorgeous watch!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2012
review_body:
This was a gift for my husband for Father's Day. He's very picky about watches and after losing his Rolex didn't really want to replace it with anything that didn't match up to his eclectic style. He actually guided my decision with the style of watch he was looking for. I ended up choosing this one for the watch band. It arrives in a long wooden box which makes it look suspended in the air, which was a really nice touch. The watch itself is beautiful. The internal workings are interesting and enchanting, and the colors really play well off each other. It's fun that you can wind the watch, but you don't even need to do that because it works off the movement of your hand. My husband has yet to let it unwind completely. It's waterproof, he's worn it in the pool without damaging it.

The only minor complaint is that when the watch isn't snug against his wrist, the ticking can get pretty loud. Nothing deafening, of course (it's only a watch), but you can hear it when you're next to him on the couch.

This is such an awesome watch that I'm hoping Rougois makes a more slender version with a bracelet strap for me!

product_title: rougois Mechanique Silver Skeleton Watch Leather Black Rivet Band
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I loved the watch so much i bought another one
review_title: I loved the watch so much i bought another one
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2018
review_body: This watch is a show stopper. I constantly have people asking about it. I had an older version of this wathc which i unfortunately lost so i bought a new one. The older version of the watch was quite finicky and i had to send it to a watch repair shop in Boston twice. It is chinese made with a fancy sounding european name "Roujois". It is nontheless a chinese made watch. After i had the watch store in boston fully tear it apart ,clean all components and put back together i never had another problem with it....until i lost it. I loved the watch so much i bought another one. It has a nice rhythmic licking sound when you hold it up to your ear, you an hear all the gears ticking etc. A nice watch if it holds togeher. unfortunatey if it breaks the only option you have is to mail it a a true watch repair shop. you can not take it to any jewelry store to have htem fix it

review_body:
The thumbnail I am posting on doesn't match the "Black Painsley" addition, but I think it is a pretty sharp looking watch.  The pattern looks interesting, and the watch face is sleek.

I haven't adjusted to the logo being on the 4'o'clock position at first glance, yet.  I hope it holds up, and for the price point, that would be the only thing I could fault it for on stars.

Stuhrling Original Men's 586B.03 Concorso 177 Date Black
Stuhrling Original Men's 586B.03 Concorso 177 Date Black
reviews:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great, except
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2016
review_body:
Up until this one watch, every one of the six purchased from Stührling, varying in price from $70 to $200, has been perfect in function and satisfying in design. Perhaps a note of caveat would be that the Kristerna glass is not as hard and shock and scratch resistant as one would expect given the manufacturers description of it. That aside, Stührling makes very reliable, elegantly designed and sturdy watches at a comfortable price range.

This unit, however, beautiful as it is, broke the pattern. I just retuned it four days ago because the chrono second hand would not zero at noon. On a subjective note, it was hard to read at a glance in lighting conditions less than bright. It is for this reason I haven't yet decided to order a replacement.

product_title: Frederique Constant Men's FC705S4S6B Slim Line Analog Display Swiss Automatic Silver Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Excellent buy
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2016
review_body:
So far, it's fantastic. It's great to see this level of quality at this price, and with a manufacture movement no less. The dial is fantastic, I couldn't tell beforehand if it was white or silver, and in person it is much the same. With daylight directly on the dial it's obviously silver, but in other light it typically looks white, giving the dial a bit of intrigue. The movement is fully decorated, with every visible surface dressed in some type of finishing. The circular cotes de Geneve on the backplate are mesmerizing.

I opted for the bracelet, which is the most comfortable bracelet I own due to the small links.

The finish of every surface is flawless, and dial can be viewed nearly sideways through the domed sapphire crystal without interference.

100% happy with my purchase. Bought this for myself to commemorate my Bachelor's degree, and I feel the level of quality is absolutely up to pat for such an occasion.

- Update 7/2016 -
Have had the watch for a fee months now, it is keeping excellent time. I do keep it on a winder when not in use. Also bought a 21mm leather strap that compliments the watch nicely.

ZIZ Poppy Flower Watch Unisex Wrist Watch, Quartz Analog Watch with Leather Band
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good purchase.
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2015
review_body: I bought the watch for my wife. The watch is just what I expected to get. There were no reviews on the watch so I couldn't get a second opinion. I had to buy out of faith and I'm satisfied with my descision. The only thing I would say that is misleading about the advertising is that the watche's face or background (the poppy flowers) is slightly different on the watch than the picture. To be more specific the "ZIZ" logo in the photo is on the top right. On the actual watch it's on the top left, the flowers aren't the exact same as shown in the photo, and the hour markers in the photo are black dots with white centers. In reality they're just black dots. Overall it's a decent watch for the price you pay because the face isn't really important when buying a watch.

product_title: Omega Seamaster James Bond 007 Limited Edition Men's Watch 212.30.41.20.01.001
reviews:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Beware of Purchasing Collectible Watches on the Gray Market
review_title: Beware of Purchasing Collectible Watches on the Gray Market
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2009
review_body: This limited edition "James Bond" Seamaster Professional appears to be a "gray market" watch which was obtained from another dealer.  The warranties on gray market watches come from the seller, not the manufacturer.  What you have to ask yourself is this:  Do I want to purchase a special, "limited edition" (10,007 watches were produced) that doesn't have a valid Omega warranty card with it?  This is not to say that there is anything at all wrong with the watch.  But Omega won't fix any problems with it.  And you are totally dependent upon the seller for service.  As for myself, if I were going to purchase a limited edition watch, I would want ALL of the paperwork to come with it, to include the original warranty cards.  I understand that purchasing a "gray market" watch can save you some money, but the savings may not always be worth it.  I've never purchased anything from this seller, and have nothing negative to state except that I don't think that a "collectible watch" that was purchased on the gray market is going to hold the same value as one with the original warranty card.  It's also a lot of money for a watch that no authorized Omega service center would work on.

product_title: Baume & Mercier Watch 10097
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    My first grown-up watch
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
review_body:
Lovely watch. I was on the market for something simple and elegant to wear on business trips, and this thing fit the bill perfectly.

Only cons are related to the band.

IMO, the original band looked and felt a little cheap, but that's not the reason I bought the watch.

Also, you'll need to buy a 20mm band. I bought a 19mm originally, and it didn't fit properly.

It's super minor, but that one extra millimeter of empty space was the only thing I could focus on whenever I looked down, and it pissed me off for weeks until I caved and bought another band. ??

Needless to say, amazing watch, and has done wonders for me. People will notice that you're starting to pay attention to the small details in life, and it will lead to more opportunity than you could ever imagine.

product_title: Omega Planet Ocean Black Dial Stainless Steel Mens Watch 232.30.46.21.01.002
Omega Planet Ocean Black Dial Stainless Steel Mens Watch 232.30.46.21.01.002
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Beautiful Watch
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2012
review_body: I've had this watch for 3 months now and initially I was going to buy a Breitling watch but I fell in love with this watch when I saw it. I love the physical appearance of the watch, the bright orange bezel, the beautifully made dial and luminous Super-LumiNova applied to the indexes on the dials and hands which shows up nicely in the dark. My favourite part of the watch is it has a transparent sapphire crystal case back to see the co-axial 8500 movements which personally is a nice feature. It has automatic winding in both directions and has a Power reserve of about 60 hours which is great as I wear this watch most days! It looks nice on my wrist, feels great and is quite weighty. I have received a lot of compliments at work from customers and collegues since purchasing it.

product_title: Omega Planet Ocean Black Dial Stainless Steel Mens Watch 232.30.46.21.01.002
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great watch! Loving it !
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2016
review_body: This was my dream watch and my dream finally came true. I have been wearing it every day and it's been very accurate, I did have omega regulate it to run +1 sec a day and it's been very precise. The quality is superb and feels very sturdy, pretty heavy but not too bad. There was a few things I didn't like at first but now I'm fine with them. The bracelet couldn't fit my wrist perfectly since there isn't a micro adjustable clasp. It was either too tight or too lose. I had to buy an extra half link from omega in order to get the right fitment. Now all is well. Second thing is, the anti reflective crystal can easily smudge but it looks amazing when it's clean. I also hear it the AR coating can scratch but mine has been okay so far. I have a tint scratch in the middle that is only visible with certai. Light/angles so it's not bothering me at all. Overall, great watch. Lived up to my expectations.

reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Tag at Amazon prime price!
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2016
review_body:
Bought direct from Amazon(prime).
The watch is lighter than expected on the wrist. It is a calibre 6 automatic....amazon lists this as a calibreS which is incorrect.
The watch looks even better than the photos. After a few weeks, the automatic movement has settled in nicely to just 1-3 seconds of time gain a day. This is well within COSC specs without the COSC price.
Slightly faster is easy to deal with(easy to adjust since it is faster, not slower).

Buying direct from Amazon is recommended.

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 165A2.33112 Winchester Reserve Automatic Stainless Steel Watch
reviews:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Im very happy with this watch- it really is a beautiful time ...
review_title: Im very happy with this watch- it really is a beautiful time ...
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2015
review_body:
Im very happy with this watch- it really is a beautiful time piece. This is not the first stuhrling watch I have purchased, and so far I havent had problems with the quality. This watch arrived in a think orange sturhling box. Its padded to protect the watch during shipment and it makes for a nice presentation if youre giving the watch as a present. The watch face is also covered with plastic to protect it from scratching.
I gave this to my boyfriend as a birthday present. He loves it and gets compliments on it every time he wears it. The look is so classy and I like watching all the components of the skeleton watch. Also, because the arms of the watch are blue theyre very easy to see so you can read the time. I feel like if they were silver they would get lost on the watch face- so I think the color is a great touch.

This watch is an automatic watch, which means it doesnt have a battery and it needs to be wound. This watch is kinetic, so as you wear it throughout the day the watch automatically winds itself which is a neat feature. The downside of this is that if you let the watch sit for too long, itll stop and youll have to reset the watch.

The one thing I will say is that this watch face is on the large side and because the band is also metal its a pretty heavy watch. The metal band is also big, we had to remove a few links for it to fit him well and hes a fairly large man. If you have small wrists I wouldnt recommend this watch, but otherwise its fantastic.

Overall I think this is a great product and it would make a fantastic gift. Im very happy I was able to purchase this watch at a promotional rate in exchange for my honest review.

product_title: Stuhrling Original Men's 165A2.334414 Winchester Reserve Automatic Rosetone Watch
Stuhrling Original Men's 165A2.334414 Winchester Reserve Automatic Rosetone Watch
reviews:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very good, despite a couple drawbacks
review_title: Very good, despite a couple drawbacks
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2014
review_body:
Its a looker of a watch, and is extremely reliable.... when its working.

Purchased in June, 2014 through a cruise line, and the one I got out of the box was defective.  It simply would not keep time correctly at all.  So when I got home, I called up Stuhrling customer service, and they were very nice and extremely helpful.  As long as you are within 90 days of purchase, Stuhrling will replace your watch, no questions asked, and will cover the full cost of shipping, so for those purchasing on Amazon, that is a very nice backup to have.

The replacement I got works very well, and keeps impressively accurate timing.  The only drawbacks I've seen are if you keep it in one position too long (especially if the face is horizontal) it will stop, so wearing it overnight sometimes will lead you to having to set the time in the morning.  However, for the most part it usually behaves extremely well, and does a good job in keeping itself wound through the course of the day.  The automatic ticking of it isn't too bad, and you rarely hear it during the day unless it catches your ear at the right angle, but it can be a little annoying at night if you don't have any white noise to drown it out.

With all that said, the one I got has a different face than the one shown here, despite being the same model.  The innards of mine are all silver, and not the Rose gold seen here.  I suspect this is an error in the photoshopping of the watches when showing the different colors available.

In the end, I absolutely love this watch, and recommend it to anyone.  I rarely go out and not get a compliment on it by those who see it.

reviews:

reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2016
review_body: I've owned a few high-end watches for several years and bought my Avenger Blackbird at an authorized dealer only because it was my first Breitling.  Simply stated, this is an awesome watch!  Very high quality, durable and looks great.  Classy without being over-sized or bulky.  Mine came with both a black and an olive-drab colored strap.  They too were very finely crafted.  I've since purchased another Breitling on Amazon, and it too is a super nice time piece.

product_title: Breitling Avenger BlackBird Men's Watch V17310101B1W1
reviews:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    It looks great, but will not last
review_title: It looks great, but will not last
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2016
review_body: Bezel and dial broke within a year.  Cloth strap frayed within months.  I only used the watch occasionally and never in a harsh environment or a rough manner.  Breitling's service center claimed "impact."  Totally untrue ... there was no impact and wasn't the slightest bit of evidence of impact - no scrathes, scuffs or marks of any kind.  It just broke.  So, the company did not stand behind its warranty and charged a fortune for the repair.  As a pilot for many years I was excited to get my first Breitling.  Now I'm afraid to wear the watch for normal everyday use and will attempt to trade it in for a more durable timepiece (and will never purchase another Breitling).  It looks great, but will not last.

product_title: Breitling Avenger BlackBird Men's Watch V17310101B1W1
reviews:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very sensitive material, scratching easily
reviewer_country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2019
review_body: I bought this very nice looking watch from a duty free store -not through Amazon- 2 weeks ago. So far I can comment on 2 issues. One is the material of the bezel which is very sensitive and scratch very easily. I do care for my watches but it is surprising how easily can scratch. The other issue has to do with the accuracy. It is very fast on my wrist and slow on the auto winder. Of course it is a mechanical watch but 5-6 seconds a day is not what someone expect when buying a Breitling. My Omega Planet Ocean Big blue is more accurate. And even my Raymond Weil Freelancer is also very accurate, of approximately 0-1 sec per day. So careful when you decide to buy. Big caution to avoid scratches, although in the course of time inevitably several will occur.
